document.title: Hawai ªi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

A50056EA28AF4523A2F01B01DC56645C.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., When other kids are happy that makes me happy).

B1D30AF20388421FA75995B5BC9D3678.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

019EA16A2A564D67B526CB2A773E8B19.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or juicy).

CEAD577AF4BC49DD8D08F812176CF923.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings:

0087F248967645AE91C38074AB87DF1E.description: Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

766215643EF84D81894A46CB28EEC612.description: Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).

4DFB3CE375014426AE7F2E25F2037D90.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., addition, additional).

5DC2AA33C7544B3381BC6FD9C00A311B.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

8F6AC848887041D8BF99F2429F6C1124.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

5082FB7885E14A27AFF18A79376490D8.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies:

23F7D1D4217F4D3EA76A005D027238D9.description: Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences.

0510E3EB3EA14CD89596601FD9027914.description: Use adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

E2678A0503D24C8482302789C286068E.description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

7CE92817A35B4E3DBD28CD0008F62AA3.description: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

8E1E8B010062486AB4CA498BAF56DC2B.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

C8493ED942BF47B3A55CCC297C67C04F.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

77A54589E097485199F56DF416CF5ACD.description: Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in coherent sentences.

26D62009634F480FB25EA887340A6C98.description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

372FB37389314A989875CD9CD51CB721.description: Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

EA82DCCF51794C858C34DF8FB2BBDEB0.description: Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under discussion.

7AF514C4F2E14B35B9021B13EDAA9AC1.description: Build on others‚Äô talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.

B0A1AA26388249469B147706CAB8271C.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

BF240C1B8A7845EABF34F7CFEC67EB78.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 2 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups:

2FCD1DD501D842C8B5440699247775C8.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

560D686E39CF40B089A13A9C4BB55B70.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations):

C402D25DF3744CFD95E56F5631A42F94.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

F994599E20024826978484EF2C7CD948.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

489AFF04C9A642F69B1242566D28E7C6.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Writing Foundations and Language standards.)

4E2EE6F35E594A65B4FEA23721CF6B8C.description: Write narratives in which they recount a well elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

98DB92B3FAB448318451B18800F2217E.description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statement or section.

438053F0F5DF4AF2B8A178FA66FFABB2.description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a conclusion that follows from the argument presented, as appropriate to the task.

E5076458E9F04589BB2DF1D6A54C046F.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

E427CBE544824D1BA8377F3B65565284.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

358FCA4178E14A2891E7C9624180B8A5.description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

D0F896CBA5274ADFBF196A70F25F0F7A.description: Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences.

8F4FC6E94A1545CFB865EE4667B2F509.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English when writing sentences and paragraphs:

9206D6D284BD40CBB363D4CBB080A344.description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

34C3220A2E7148A9B760842FF662C592.description: Spell common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words.

4ECC6838EB134EC493831DD3A21E12E4.description: Changing y to i (e.g., cried, babies)

9E7158959D33441AB45BDB87E98888A8.description: With prompting and support, spell two- and three-syllable words that:

347F671853884603BA55A04CB32D0566.description: Include the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes (e.g., un-, re-, en-, -ful, -ment, -less)

D53184E8AEAA4EC79664A61BD455B2D3.description: Include familiar compound words (e.g., houseboat, yellowtail)

B24D98F76EBA42E095A95D3327829871.description: Combine closed, open, vowel teams, vowel-r, and CVe (Consonant-Vowel-silent e) syllables (e.g., compete, robot, violet, understand)

A697CCF0A5C1420CA5CBAFB782A57ACA.description: With prompting and support, spell two- and three-syllable words that:

EF8FEB6321BF4183B4E2B2CA4D6CBC2D.description: Three consonant blends (str, scr, spr) and blends with digraphs (thr, shr)

77AC16199A9E4C9A99F734DC6ADF6732.description: All jobs of y (as consonant /y/; as /ƒ´/ on ends of single-syllable words like fly; as /ƒì/ on ends of multisyllabic words like baby; as /ƒ≠/ in a few words like gym and myth)

EA193083467A41CC96311F512EA871E8.description: Vowel-r combinations, including er, ar, or (e.g., car, her, stir, for, burn)

9C36A46B4FA940A09B8B58EE42D35B4D.description: Long vowel patterns spelled correctly, including common vowel teams (e.g., boat, play, wait, see, team, right)

A0E4A5746BFF4ED9991A5125846C251E.description: Spell common, regular, single-syllable words using:

D52D2D18DEE248AC935724C143F36E6B.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words:

63349E024B3B47E492A32C7144F20886.description: Transcribe ideas in manuscript with automaticity and proper spacing.

F45ECE37B7334B4DB89D3671771F892B.description: Write legibly in manuscript using correct letter formation.

A6F485547FE5488AA35738C620884179.description: Demonstrate and apply correct handwriting skills:

9FA7357DFC274A4489BC0712F6D3827D.description: Read and comprehend literary texts appropriately complex for grade 2.

C5B0FFD69C0045158380CAC0A07EB1EB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A1281F3FFE9442A08522119058B45165.description: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.

0D981CE0817245EAB957C807C944E4CE.description: Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

3E9DCCB62C3641E8B57F483BB72B3729.description: Acknowledge differences in the perspectives of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

B90A5DCCAC8248EDB1E92C46C2DBE567.description: Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

8CCF95D821574FDAB7731C6A8C049B54.description: Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

F89171BE5BA44C7CB5CA0CE521926370.description: Using key details, describe characters and their traits in a story, and how they respond to major events (plot) and challenges.

11481FF87CA54C54B26183C18DA23606.description: Retell stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures.

1CFE73C006AD4F0DAD672EA4B81CE4AF.description: Ask and answer who, what, where, when, why, and how questions to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

3DEA9F2F628C4B258EE2E5A42EDA2BAD.description: Read and comprehend informational texts appropriately complex for grade 2.

0A5002496FD6401E94C313B797D13F99.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

3F5F478DCF414D65B9EC69CAE1C80942.description: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

37105329D8F441A28C38369766DFC1B4.description: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.

261FBFD59B284C368FD5E3F90C2D0DC9.description: Explain how specific visual aids (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

F34168FC666947B5970081FEEE59F610.description: Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

0D97DC7B6E3648CDA395A3277CBD2E70.description: Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

2574056F26F54F5882952B8B151E1325.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

092CB4A64D3646E59FFB94A5FB95A176.description: Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

63B867494DF04902B040671F86812266.description: Identify the focus of specific paragraphs within a multiparagraph text.

504FE57633534CA7974E2D3644ADFAD0.description: Identify the main/central topic of a multiparagraph text.

6B71BD2AE93B4187B0CAD6AE6355911D.description: Ask and answer who, what, where, when, why, and how questions to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

16166FF87B40475DB4641C0990DC465A.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.

1E43AB13DCB545349C22E8005634CDB2.description: Read common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words by sight (e.g., eat, can, the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

814E64A77F1F4A7D80C18DB3AF354FD0.description: Apply knowledge of the 6 syllable types when reading one- and 2-syllable words (open, closed, VCE, r-controlled, consonant + le, and vowel teams).

FE71C5242BF2425F8362212D0C353E3E.description: Less Common Prefixes (e.g., fore-, pro-, intra-, inter-, trans-, non-, over-, sub-, etc.)

A12398E2A2424CF9B21CD3FBC044FA22.description: Inflectional Suffixes with spelling change (e.g., carry, carries)

724683EBDD024A37B335FD1335F1640C.description: Complex Vowel-r Combinations (e.g., are, air, our, ore, ear, eer, ure, etc.)

3E5FFAFE325C4F529A037157F519BDB5.description: Digraphs ph (/f/), gh (/f/), and ch (/k/ and /sh/)

6CBF3A718303410D8E7ABF319A3A60F1.description: Read one- and 2-syllable words in isolation and in text, including:

E1A7C75C736340AEA05CFB4AC16887DE.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to read:

095C8C09B3A04EEFA319875962F517F9.description: Add, delete, or substitute individual sounds in initial, medial, or final position in single-syllable words to make new words, including substitution within consonant blends.

3A76632B60F3488EB549844C95F78FF2.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes):
